title: HPE Design Workshop: Design thinking for disruptive ideas, Empathy and Brainstorming
content: Do you have ideas that need to be explored? Do you know who your users are? What if you had no limitations? Discover your next big idea in IT and win a prize in this fast-paced human-centered collaborative design session. Everybody is welcome to attend.

title: HPE Design Workshop: Design thinking for disruptive ideas, Empathy and Brainstorming
content: Do you have ideas that need to be explored? Do you know who your users are? What if you had no limitations? Discover your next big idea in IT and win a prize in this fast-paced human-centered collaborative design session. Everybody is welcome to attend.

title: HPE Design Workshop: Design, sprint, go. Rapid prototyping and the customer feedback loop (two-part series)
track: AI, HPC and Big Data Analytics; Security, Governance and Compliance
content: Why build a prototype? Don't make long-term investments of money on ideas that have unproven customer value. Design, sprint, go. Pick a use case, design mock-ups, develop a prototype and test it with a customer. Learn how to fail faster while making compelling experiences all while engaging your team and unlocking your potential. Everybody is welcome to attend this session.

title: HPE Design Workshop: Design, sprint, go. Rapid prototyping and the customer feedback loop (two-part series)
track: AI, HPC and Big Data Analytics; Security, Governance and Compliance
content: Why build a prototype? Don't make long-term investments of money on ideas that have unproven customer value. Design, sprint, go. Pick a use case, design mock-ups, develop a prototype and test it with a customer. Learn how to fail faster while making compelling experiences all while engaging your team and unlocking your potential. Everybody is welcome to attend this session.

title: HPE Design Workshop: Tools that help your customers and partners build amazing experiences
track: AI, HPC and Big Data Analytics; Edge and IoT Solutions
content: Did you know that as a partner, customer or individual you have access to a vast amount of resources fueled by HPE's own design team and the open source community?  We'll walk through HPE.Design thinking and share some tips and tricks that you can take back to your developers, designers and product teams to create world class experiences. Everybody is welcome to attend this session.

title: HPE Design Workshop: User experience research tools and techniques that drive customer experience
content: Learn how insights from user experience research and design can improve the outcome of your product roadmap. In this session, we'll guide you through a multi-disciplinary approach to UX research and design strategy. Walk away with shared resources that will enable you to partake in the design journey with us. Everybody is welcome to attend this session.

title: HPE Design Workshop: User experience research tools and techniques that drive customer experience
content: Learn how insights from user experience research and design can improve the outcome of your product roadmap. In this session, we'll guide you through a multi-disciplinary approach to UX research and design strategy. Walk away with shared resources that will enable you to partake in the design journey with us. Everybody is welcome to attend this session.

title: Hack Shack Workshop: Dive into infrastructure automation with the HPE OneView API
content: Bring your laptop, get comfortable and be ready to learn about HPE OneView, HPE's composable infrastructure management platform designed to help accelerate your customer outcomes. During our interactive session, we'll explore the API using Postman. After that, we will use PowerShell (or Python) to write a script that automates HPE OneView. By the end of the workshop, you will have written a simple example of infrastructure as code. All experience levels are welcome.

title: Hack Shack Workshop: HPE OneView Global Dashboard REST API
content: Come and experiment with HPE OneView Global Dashboard REST API. Learn how you can interact programmatically with multiple HPE OneView appliances in a large, distributed environment through a single pane of glass. For this follow-along demonstration, we encourage you to bring your own laptop and replicate what the speaker is doing during the session.

title: Hack Shack Workshop: HPE OneView Global Dashboard REST API
content: Come and experiment with HPE OneView Global Dashboard REST API. Learn how you can interact programmatically with multiple HPE OneView appliances in a large, distributed environment through a single pane of glass. For this follow-along demonstration, we encourage you to bring your own laptop and replicate what the speaker is doing during the session.

title: Hack Shack Workshop: Simplify edge and IoT management with intent-driven computing
content: Managing applications distributed from your infrastructure's edge to the core in hybrid cloud environments is a challenging task. Service operators need to manually configure and assign resources to each service component to achieve the desired performance. In this session, we propose an intent-based computing framework, named Libere, to free users from tedious and complicated configuration tasks by automatically managing applications based on performance goals.

title: Hack Shack Workshop: Simplify edge and IoT management with intent-driven computing
content: Managing applications distributed from your infrastructure's edge to the core in hybrid cloud environments is a challenging task. Service operators need to manually configure and assign resources to each service component to achieve the desired performance. In this session, we propose an intent-based computing framework, named Libere, to free users from tedious and complicated configuration tasks by automatically managing applications based on performance goals.

title: Hack Shack Workshop: Use HPE SimpliVity REST API fundamentals to build a simple automation script in the SimpliVity
content: Interested in learning about HPE SimpliVity? Bring your laptop and join us in the Hack Shack backyard to learn how to interact with the HPE SimpliVity hyperconverged platform through its REST API. Explore the API description, communicate with the HPE OmniStack Virtual Controller and use PowerShell (or Python) to automate the kind of HPE SimpliVity use case that may come up in your day-to-day work. Learn how it can accelerate your customer outcomes. Beginners and experts are welcome. Come prepared to code at this session.

title: Hack Shack Workshop: Use HPE SimpliVity REST API fundamentals to build a simple automation script in the SimpliVity
content: Interested in learning about HPE SimpliVity? Bring your laptop and join us in the Hack Shack backyard to learn how to interact with the HPE SimpliVity hyperconverged platform through its REST API. Explore the API description, communicate with the HPE OmniStack Virtual Controller and use PowerShell (or Python) to automate the kind of HPE SimpliVity use case that may come up in your day-to-day work. Learn how it can accelerate your customer outcomes. Beginners and experts are welcome. Come prepared to code at this session.

title: Hack Shack Workshop: Use network optimization with HPE Composable Fabric to accelerate operations
content: In this workshop, we will explore how HPE Composable Fabric affinity technology can streamline operations by automatically adjusting to different network needs (i.e. daytime versus nighttime). Different example workloads will be examined to show how they compete for bandwidth and how adding an automated storage affinity, i.e. HPE SimpliVity, can help. Time permitting, we'll walk through a big data scenario comparing nighttime ingestion and daytime analytics, reconfiguring the network with cron jobs. All experience levels are welcome.

title: Hack Shack Workshop: Using RedFish API, monitor and manage HPE ProLiant servers from core to edge
track: AI, HPC and Big Data Analytics; Edge and IoT Solutions
content: The Redfish API is an open, industry-standard, modern RESTful API specification designed to simplify the monitoring and management of the software-defined data center. Join us for a demonstration of the iLO Redfish API where we demonstrate the configuration and monitoring of Redfish Event Service compliant infrastructure using Nagios Core monitoring engine. Technology visionaries will find this engaging.

title: Hack Shack workshop: Improve day two operations with your own custom automation with the HPE Nimble Storage REST API
track: Edge and IoT Solutions; Intelligent Storage
content: It's difficult to avoid using custom automation for your day-to-day operations. This workshop provides guidance on how to do so for HPE Nimble Storage, using REST API tools to quickly get you started. Bring your own laptop with VMware Workstation Player (VMware Fusion for Mac) installed and you'll get access to your own personal Nimble Virtual Array (a limited but great perk). To participate, basic knowledge of block storage is helpful. Participants should generally understand scripting and manipulating data structures. All levels are welcome.

title: Hack Shack workshop: Learn about our most popular open source library, Grommet, a class-leading, React-based UI/UX framework
track: AI, HPC and Big Data Analytics; Hybrid Cloud
content: Are you ready to turn stunning designs into pixel-perfect accessible web applications? Join the Grommet core team and learn how you can start using Grommet to build class-leading web applications. All experience levels are welcome.

title: Hack Shack workshop: Persist, optimize and accelerate using persistent storage in Kubernetes
content: Learn how to address persistent storage in Kubernetes. We'll explain the differences between storing data locally versus externally and what workload types in Kubernetes are suitable for persistent storage. An overview of API-related objects, such as StorageClass, PersistentVolumeClaim and PersistentVolume, will be included, along with storage plugins and drivers. A basic understanding of Kubernetes is helpful to follow the examples. We'll be using HPE Nimble Storage Virtual Arrays to provision the external storage.

title: Hack Shack Challenge with HPE OneView: Locate the rogue server in a large data center
content: Apply the skills that you’ve learned to find the misbehaving server using only limited information and iLO logs. No registration required. Just show up and start coding.

title: Hack Shack Challenge with HPE OneView Global Dashboard: Creating and populating a resource group
content: Show off your ability to enhance an existing PowerShell module or create and populate a group of HPE OneView resources using HPE Global Dashboard REST API. No registration required. Just show up and start coding.

title: Hack Shack Challenge with HPE SimpliVity API: Build simple reports that show the status of on-going backups with user-defined time interval
content: Leverage the granularity and simplicity of the SimpliVity REST API to build a report. Keep it simple or unleash your creativity to come up with a cool 3D graphical representation. No registration required. Just show up and start coding.

title: Hack Shack Challenge with HPE SimpliVity: Build a solution to inject user scripts before and after a backup
content: Use the SimpliVity REST API to build a solution for pre-and-post backup script injection to enable backup life cycle management use cases. No registration required. Just show up and start coding.

title: Hack Shack Challenge with HPE SimpliVity: Create the most powerful backup script
content: Learn innovative ways of producing bulletproof backups using the HPE SimpliVity REST API. No registration required. Just show up and start coding.

title: Hack Shack Challenge with HPE Composable Fabric Manager: Initiate Composable Fabric operations through social applications
content: Build a dashboard that shows the current network view configuration of the Composable Fabric mesh network quickly. Prizes will be awarded to the most innovative solution. No registration required. Just show up and start coding.

title: Hack Shack Challenge - Join HPE “Hello World” and get started on understanding scripting
content: Learn how to code or improve your current coding skills. Your hack can be as simple as showing Hello World in notepad or a text editor like Vim. To win the prize, remember, creativity counts! No registration required. Just show up and start coding.

title: Hack Shack Challenge - You’ve heard of soup to nuts. Now, join us for a napkin to template challenge.
content: Learn how to code or improve your current coding skills. Your hack can be as simple as showing Hello World in notepad or a text editor like Vim. To win the prize, remember, creativity counts! No registration required. Just show up and start coding.

title: Hack Shack Challenge for HPE Proliant for Azure Stack Administrators/Operators – Provisioning services and enabling DevOps for tenants
content: As an Azure Stack cloud administrator, you can create IaaS, PaaS offers that your tenant users can self-subscribe to. Here you’ll learn how to use PowerShell and/or admin portal to create/configure service offers with plans, quotas and enable user subscriptions. No registration required. Just show up and start coding.

title: Hack Shack Challenge to seamlessly deploy hybrid cloud solution infrastructure with HPE Proliant for Azure Stack – Deploy apps to Azure and Azure Stack using an infrastructure-as-code template
content: Explore the concept of using infrastructure as code to deploy application resources globally via Azure or Azure Stack. You’ll also learn how to integrate HPE Nimble solutions as external storage for virtual machines running on Azure Stack. No registration required. Just show up and start coding.
